title: Using the Calculator
text: Plug values into the invNorm(percentile, mean of sums, stdev of sums) function on the calculator. To navigate invNorm, press the 2nd key, vars, and then $$3$$.
speech: Plug values into the invNorm(percentile, mean of sums, stdev of sums) function on the calculator. To navigate invNorm, press the 2nd key, vars, and then  3 .

title: Percentile
text: What is the percentile? Enter your answer in decimal form.
speech: What is the percentile? Enter your answer in decimal form.

title: Mean of Sums
text: What is the mean of sums? In other words, what is (n)(μₓ) where $$n$$ is the sample size and μₓ is the mean of X?

subHints.text: What is μₓ, the mean of X (tablet users)?

title: Standard Deviation of the Sums
text: What is the standard deviation of the sums? In other words, what is $$\sqrt{n}$$ σₓ where $$n$$ is the sample size and σₓ is the standard deviation of X (tablet users)? Round to the nearest hundredths place.

subHints.title: Solving for Square Root of the Sample Size
subHints.text: What is $$\sqrt{n}$$? Round to the nearest thousandths place.

subHints.text: What is σₓ, the standard deviation of X (tablet users)?

subHints.title: Standard Deviation of the Sums
subHints.text: What is $$15\sqrt{50}$$? Round to the nearest hundredths place.

title: Plugging Into the ∑x Equation
text: Plug your values into the invNorm(percentile, mean of sums, stdev of sums) function on the calculator. Remember to round your answer to the nearest tenths place.

title: Plugging Into invNorm
text: Using the calculator, what is $$invNorm(0.80$$, (50)(34), sqrt(50)(15))? Round to the nearest tenth place.
